result.execSummary:
The defendant LUCILLE M MILLER was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater, Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Current extended supervision being served.  Concurrent with 21CF547.

miscConds.notes: Outstanding financial obligations are not a condition of probation & are to be paid directly to the Shawano Co Clerk of Court office within 30 days.  Debts older than 60 days will be processed for tax intercept & civil judgments.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  Payment plans available for qualifying amounts.

Give DNA sample.
AODA and followthrough.  Any other counseling determined by agent.
Absolute sobriety.    No entry into any Class B licensed establishments.
No contact with victim without agent approval.
Restitution if requested.
Full-time employment/school or 9 hours community service per week.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. LUCILLE M MILLER

records.addlTxt: amended per order to 2 yrs probation

Notice of Intent to Certify Debt w/WI. State Debt Collections
Shawano County DNA Proof of Submission already on file.

10:27 AM Defendant LUCILLE M MILLER in court with attorney Elisabeth Lynn Stockbridge.  Defendant LUCILLE M MILLER in custody.  Joseph J. Kaupie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea questionnaire received and reviewed.  ADA Kaupie recites the recommendation.  Defendant enters a plea of no contest.  Court advises party of their rights, gives citizenship/deportation admonition, finds factual basis, accepts defendant's waiver of their rights, the plea made, and finds guilty.  Remarks by Atty. Kaupie and Atty. Stockbridge.  Defendant makes a statement.  Court makes its findings and pronounces sentence.  Appeal rights given.  

SENTENCE:  withheld sentence - 3 years probation, consecutive to current extended supervision.  92 days sentence credit requested and ordered if revoked.
$ 243.00 court costs
$200.00 DNA SC and give sample.

EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
AODA and followthrough.  Any other counseling determined by agent.
Absolute sobriety.    No entry into any Class B licensed establishments.
No contact with victim without agent approval.
Restitution if requested.
Full-time employment/school or 9 hours community service per week.
